instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1278 820-2879-B Power Question
threads.message:
Hello Everyone
So I am currently working on a A1278 820-2879-B motherboard and would like it to prompt to boot. Can someone please share some knowledge on how to make this motherboard boot outside of its enclosure. I would like to run my Thermal camera on it to track down some stuff. Motherboard currently gets the green light on power cord so SMC is good.

threads.title: A1278 820-2879-B Power Question
threads.message:
Close R5014/15 pads for a short time; using tweezer tip...

Better solder tiny wire (isolated) at SMC_ONOFF_L.
Every time you touch the ground with it, is same as pressing power button.
